revised_title: Swedish Arctic Expedition of 1868: Further Particulars and Observations
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Climate Change
tldr: The author, A. I. Nordenskiöld, provides an update on the Swedish Arctic Expedition of 1868. Due to limited time, he cannot send a detailed report but promises one soon. The expedition collected geological, zoological, and botanical samples. They encountered ice in the polar sea up to 81° 9' latitude but found the sea open a week later. The expedition plans to continue exploring the Arctic regions.
